message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,300,000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the value it holds for you.  Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the value I can get out of the product.

Bob, I understand your perspective on the price, but $900,000 is simply too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway. Let's try $1,100,000. This still leaves you a good margin for profit, and it's closer to what I need to get for the product.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit too far apart. I'm willing to go up to $950,000, but I don't think I can go any higher than that. Can you meet me at $950,000?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still not comfortable with $950,000. I'm willing to go down to $1,000,000, which is my minimum. This is a fair price considering the value of the product. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to move on to another buyer.
